item.title: Bar-sized factorial
item.description: What’s the first five digits of 1,000,000! or 1 million factorial? Let’s ask Haskell: Prelude> take 5 $ show $ product [1..1000000] "82639" (1043.56 secs, 1,444,511,743,624 bytes) Neat! But you might ask, how many digits is this rather large number, of 1 bar factorial? Let’s ask again: Prelude> length $ show $ product [1..1000000] 5565709 (1103.04 secs, 1,444,845,773,000 bytes) Wow! 5.5 million digits! Way more than all the electrons in the universe.
